The volume of the solid is determined by the displacement of air, which is measured by the change in water level in the U-tube.
The difference in water levels (h) in the U-tube indicates the volume of air displaced.
The volume of air displaced is equal to the volume of the solid.
Using the formula V = A * h, where A is the cross-sectional area of the U-tube and h is the height difference.
Given A = 5.0 × 10⁻⁴ m² and h = 1.56 × 10⁻¹ m, calculate V = 5.0 × 10⁻⁴ m² * 1.56 × 10⁻¹ m.
